title: Raw Input: GetRawInputDeviceInfoA Return Signature Change
body:
The function GetRawInputDeviceInfoA in the Raw Input API can return three values. Those are a nonzero value, 0, or a -1.
However, due to this function having a UINT as its return signature. You cannot simply do something like
if ( GetRawInputDeviceInfoA() > 0 ) {success case} else {failure case}
As if the function returned a -1, all the bits are set. And since the return signature is UINT. The value will be 4,294,967,295.
Obviously you can just cast to a signed integer. But changing the return signature to a signed integer will save people some amount of time.
Thank you for taking the time to read this!
